Text.Value: *It utters an angry bellow and charges.*
Yes. You are right. There is work, only work. I will clear the rock.
*Its eyes flicker towards the duergar, burning with raw, bestial rage.*
Meet its eyes. Show it how calm you are - all is well.
*Grunt.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Deep rothe is unsettled - snorting and shuffling, shaking its head etc.

Text.Value: *The creature is disturbed, its breath quickened by anger and fear.*
No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!
*Huff.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Sound FX only - do not record.

Text.Value: No. Everyone hurts us. Now we hurt everyone back!

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry. Everyone's taking advantage of her.

Text.Value: *No good. The rothé is more agitated than ever.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Animal gets more agitated - combat imminent.

Text.Value: Incline your head towards the duergar. They're the real problem.
Hit the rothé.
You helped me. I help you.
What has you in such a state?
*Roar!*
Leave.
Display your palms and murmur soft, low reassurances.
Breathe. Focus. If you strike, your masters will destroy the herd.
*The rothé looks at you with big, soft eyes. Then it lowers its head obediently.*
*The rothé pauses, then growls in assent.*
You were made to serve. This is your meaning. Remove the rubble, as you were told.
Leave.
Do me a favour, smash through the rubble before you go.
*Grunt.*
Lies. You're just like them, with their canes and shouting. No more!
Yes. They made the pain. Now they feel it!

EditorData.NodeContext: She's been egged on by the player to attack her duergar handlers.

Text.Value: Hit the rothé.
Duergar can't hurt anymore. Will wait until it's safe to leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals line - bestial and fragmented. Glad that the duergar are gone (ether dead or ordered elsewhere)

Text.Value: *The rothé utters an angry bellow and charges.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Rothe reacts to being struck and turns hostile. Actual hit can be hidden off-screen.

Text.Value: *The deep rothé's agitation intensifies. It is primed to attack.*
Got to move rock. Only the rock.
Will find a safe place. No more hurt.
No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!
Nod to the rubble. Perhaps the creature will break through.
*The rothé regards its duergar captors balefully, then utters a deep, angry bellow.*
All right. We will work. We will do as we're told. We will clear the way.
Don't want to move rocks. Too much pain, too much noise.
Leave.
Old death. Fire. I can smell it. It is too much, too much. Anger - can't hold it in!
Encourage it to breathe, and get back to work. There is only the work.
You're just like them. Won't let you push me around. Any of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Speak with animals - shocked and angry after being struck. About to turn hostile.

Text.Value: *The rothé seems calmer in your presence.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Rothe calms, player slowly reaches out to rothe's head
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The rothé snorts and shuffles on its hooves

Text.Value: Give in to your rage and avenge your pain. Don't strike us all, just your masters.
Leave.
*Bellow.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Animal should seem skittish and possibly dangerous - fight or flight instinct

Synopsis: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
